etymology.description: 中国 (China) + 结 (knot) = a Chinese-style decorative knot.
etymology.interpretation: Names the traditional decorative knotting art associated with Chinese culture. Conveys auspiciousness and is often used in celebrations and home decor.
etymology.simplification: 國 was simplified to 国 by reducing the interior component to lower stroke count; 結 was simplified to 结 by changing the silk radical 糸 to 纟 while keeping the phonetic 吉.

examples.chinese: 我买了一个红色的中国结(我買了一個紅色的中國結)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ mǎi le yí gè hóngsè de Zhōngguó jié.
examples.english: I bought a red Chinese knot.

examples.chinese: 春节时(春節時)，人们把中国结挂在门口(人們把中國結掛在門口)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié shí, rénmen bǎ Zhōngguó jié guà zài ménkǒu.
examples.english: During Spring Festival, people hang Chinese knots at the doorway.

examples.chinese: 中国结象征着吉祥和团圆(中國結象徵著吉祥和團圓)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōngguó jié xiàngzhēng zhe jíxiáng hé tuányuán.
examples.english: Chinese knots symbolize good fortune and reunion.
